ScreenDetailedAvailTop.summary:
The availTop read-only property of the
interface is a number representing the y-coordinate (top edge) of the available screen area inside the OS virtual screen arrangement, relative to the multi-screen origin.

remarks.para: This is equal to the property, plus the height of any OS UI element drawn at the top of the screen. Windows cannot be placed in those areas, so availTop is useful for giving you the top boundary of the actual area available to open or place windows.

blockquote.para: A non-standard implementation of the availTop property is available on the Screen interface in all browsers. See the Non-standard example below for usage details, and see the Screen reference page for browser support information relating to the non-standard implementation.
